_header: After giving I speak of taking
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Of discretioun in taking’ — ten 5-line stanzas including refrain: ‘In taking sowld discretioun be’

CULLl510.First Lines:
Eftir giffing we will speik of takingBot litle of na guide giffis
                    forsaiking…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…Thai ar schameit for evir and yn successiounIn asking giffing
                    and taking sould discretioun be

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Eftir geffing we will speik of takingBot Litle of na gude gistis
                    forsaiking…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Thai ar schamit for evir and þair successiounIn asking
                    geving and taking suld discretioun be
CamMagPep2553.Note:
No separation between this and preceding 6002; usually 10 x 5, aabab, with refr.; this MS
                    missing stanzas 4 & 8.
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.292-4.

Banna.First Lines:
Eftir geving I speik of takingBot littill of ony gud
                    forsaiking…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Schamit for evir and þair successiounIn taking sowld
                    discretioun be
Banna.Note: Eight stanzas only in this MS.
